segment.source: How to deploy App-V 5.0 Packages Using Electronic Software Distribution
segment.target: How to deploy App-V 5.0 Packages Using Electronic Software Distribution

segment.source: How to deploy App-V 5.0 Packages Using Electronic Software Distribution
segment.target: How to deploy App-V 5.0 Packages Using Electronic Software Distribution

segment.source: How to deploy App-V 5.0 Packages Using Electronic Software Distribution
segment.target: How to deploy App-V 5.0 Packages Using Electronic Software Distribution

segment.source: You can use an electronic software distribution (ESD) system to deploy App-V 5.0 virtual applications to App-V clients.
segment.target: You can use an electronic software distribution (ESD) system to deploy App-V 5.0 virtual applications to App-V clients.

segment.source: For details, see the documentation available with the ESD you are using.
segment.target: For details, see the documentation available with the ESD you are using.

segment.source: For component requirements and options for using an ESD to deploy App-V packages, see Planning to Deploy App-V 5.0 with an Electronic Software Distribution System.
segment.target: For component requirements and options for using an ESD to deploy App-V packages, see Planning to Deploy App-V 5.0 with an Electronic Software Distribution System.

segment.source: Use one of the following methods to publish packages to App-V client computers with an ESD:
segment.target: Use one of the following methods to publish packages to App-V client computers with an ESD:

segment.source: Method
segment.target: Method

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Functionality provided by a third-party ESD
segment.target: Functionality provided by a third-party ESD

segment.source: Use the functionality in a third-party ESD.
segment.target: Use the functionality in a third-party ESD.

segment.source: Stand-alone Windows Installer
segment.target: Stand-alone Windows Installer

segment.source: Install the application on the target client computer by using the associated Windows Installer (.msi) file that is created when you initially sequence an application.
segment.target: Install the application on the target client computer by using the associated Windows Installer (.msi) file that is created when you initially sequence an application.

segment.source: The Windows Installer file contains the associated App-V 5.0 package file information used to configure a package and copies the required package files to the client.
segment.target: The Windows Installer file contains the associated App-V 5.0 package file information used to configure a package and copies the required package files to the client.

segment.source: PowerShell
segment.target: PowerShell

segment.source: Use PowerShell cmdlets to deploy virtualized applications.
segment.target: Use PowerShell cmdlets to deploy virtualized applications.

segment.source: For more information about using PowerShell and App-V 5.0, see Administering App-V by Using PowerShell.
segment.target: For more information about using PowerShell and App-V 5.0, see Administering App-V by Using PowerShell.

segment.source: To deploy App-V 5.0 packages by using an ESD
segment.target: To deploy App-V 5.0 packages by using an ESD

segment.source: Install the App-V 5.0 Sequencer on a computer in your environment.
segment.target: Install the App-V 5.0 Sequencer on a computer in your environment.

segment.source: For more information about installing the sequencer, see How to Install the Sequencer.
segment.target: For more information about installing the sequencer, see How to Install the Sequencer.

segment.source: Use the App-V 5.0 Sequencer to create virtual application.
segment.target: Use the App-V 5.0 Sequencer to create virtual application.

segment.source: For information about creating a virtual application, see Creating and Managing App-V 5.0 Virtualized Applications.
segment.target: For information about creating a virtual application, see Creating and Managing App-V 5.0 Virtualized Applications.

segment.source: After you create the virtual application, deploy the package by using your ESD solution.
segment.target: After you create the virtual application, deploy the package by using your ESD solution.

segment.source: If you are using System Center Configuration Manager, start by reviewing Introduction to Application Management in Configuration Manager for information about using App-V 5.0 and System Center 2012 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: If you are using System Center Configuration Manager, start by reviewing Introduction to Application Management in Configuration Manager for information about using App-V 5.0 and System Center 2012 Configuration Manager.
